items.question: Looking for any information on the Musical Score/Soundtrack
items.answer: I loved the music/score, so I took a look at the credits and discovered the following:Ludovico Einaudi - Cold Wind Variations (variations 1 and 2) which comes from his piece, titled, Seven Days Walking (hear on YouTube)King Arthur, or The British Worthy (1691) / Act 3 - What Power art thou? Composed by Henry Purcell Performed by Andreas SchollCasta Diva (Act 1 aria) from Norma (opera by Bellini), sung by Maria Callas.Les PÃªcheurs de Perles, the aria titled: Je crois entendre encore Composed by Georges Bizet Performed by Cyrille Dubois (beautiful version as you hear in the film is on YouTube.Hospital Nightmare (David Menke)

items.question: Where exactly is the large outdoor sculpture of the partial head that appears in the film? And the artist?

spoilerItems.question: The picture aside Anthony's bed probably showed him along with 2 women believed to be his 2 daughters. One of them resembled Laura (Poots). But the other resembled The Woman (Williams) rather than Anne (Coleman). Laura would have made at least some sense as Anthony had described Laura to be resembing Lucy and with regard to how Anthony's fading perception of reality had been depicted throughout the movie. But shouldn't Anne instead of The Woman be visible on the picture, as Anthony was still recognizing her?
